Topics.value: Revision of first term work and examination

Learning Objects.value: Revision of all learning activities in the first term JSS1

Learning Activities.value: Revision of all learning activities used in the first term history

Embedded Core Skills.value: Revision of all embedded core skills used in JSS1 First term History

Learning Resources.value: Revision of all learning activities resources used in the first term

Topics.value: Centres of Ancient Civilization in Nigeria

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: Identify centre of Ancient Civilization in Nigeria i.e. Nok, Igbo ukwu, Benin, Ile-ife etc.Relate the importance of Museum to historical development of Nigeria.Identify the significance of Wildlife Park, Zoo, Botanical gardens, Statues and Monument etc. to Nigeria development today.

Learning Activities.value: Student in a whole class Brain storm and name various centres of Ancient Civilization in their localities.Student in small groups examine the significance of museum to the development of tourism in NigeriaStudents as a class mention the relevance of Zoo, Statues etc. To the development of Nigeria.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Creativity of innovation.Digital Literacy.Collaboration of Communication.

Learning Resources.value: Map of Nigeria depicting Various Centers of Ancient Civilization.Pictures, Drawings, Samples of Historical Artifacts.Organize excursion to historical site of significance in Nigeria i.e. National Museum Lagos, War museum, Umuahia.Internet Resources

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: Identify Nok on the Map of Nigeria.Describe the Nok culture origin, Features and the significance to Nigeria Society today.Explain the advantage and Limitation of the Nok Ancient Civilization in Nigeria today.

Learning Activities.value: Students in small groups locate Nok on the Map of Nigeria.Students as a class identify the features and significance of Nok Civilization.Students as a class brainstorm and describe the advantages and disadvantage of Nok Culture and civilization to Nigerian tourism today.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Collaboration and Communication.Creativity and innovation.Digital Literacy.

Learning Resources.value: Map of Nigeria depicting Nok civilization.Sample of Artifacts, Picture, Drawing etc. Internet Resources

Topics.value: Ancient Historical Sites in Nigeria Ile-ife and Benin

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: Identify Ile-Ife and Benin on Nigeria map.Examine the origin, features, significance and the impact of ile-ife ancient Historical Site to tourism Development in Nigeria.Relate the origin, structure, characteristics discoveries and effect of Benin ancient Centres of civilization on Nigerian Growth and Development.

Learning Activities.value: Students as a class identify Ile-Ife and Benin on Nigeria map.Examine the origin, features, significance and the impact of Ile-Ife ancient Historical Site to tourism Development in Nigeria.Relate the origin, structure, characteristics discoveries and effect of Benin ancient Centres of civilization on Nigerian Growth and Development.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Civilization and Communication.Creativity and Innovation.Digital Literacy.

Learning Resources.value: Map of Nigeria indicating Ile-Ife and Benin historical site.Sample of artifacts drawings pictures etc.Internet Resources www.ileife.ancient.centre.ng.

Topics.value: Igbo Ukwu as an Ancient Civilization

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: Mention the Igbo Ukwu as an ancient Civilization.Describe the Igbo Ukwu Origin, features, discoveries and the significance to Nigeria society today.Explain the advantages and disadvantages of Igbo Ukwu centre of Ancient Civilization in Nigeria today.

Learning Activities.value: Students in small groups identify the Igbo Ukwu on Map of Nigeria.Students as a class discuss the origin, features and significance of Igbo Ukwu.Students as a class analyse the advantages and disadvantages of Igbo Ukwu ancient civilization in Nigeria today.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Collaboration and Communication.Creativity and Innovation.Digital Literacy.

Learning Resources.value: Map of Nigeria showing Igbo Ukwu Civilization.Samples of artifacts pictures drawing etc.Internet resources www.Igboukwu.ancient.centres.org

Topics.value: Other Notable historical sites in Nigeria

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: Mention other historical significance in Nigeria.Relate the origin, importance, features and discoveries in other notable historical sites in Nigeria I.e. Esie-soap Stones archeology Osun Oshogbo Groove, Ikami Monolattus rock etc.Describe the merits and limitations of Archeology to the growth and development of Nigeria socialization.

Learning Activities.value: Students in whole class discussion name the Various ancient centers of Significance in their locality.Student in think pair share relate the significance, features, socialization and discoveries in other notable historical sites of significance in Nigeria.Student in a small group activities examine the merits and demerits of Archeology to the growth and Development of Tourism in Nigeria.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Creativity and Innovation.Collaboration and Innovation.Digital Literacy.

Learning Resources.value: Map of Nigeria.Samples of artifacts for other notable historical sites in Nigeria i.e. Esie Soap Stone Opa-Oranmiyan in Ile-Ife.Journals, Magazines, Video and Audio Clips Organized to historical Site.Internet Resources www.other-ancient-site-of civilization-in-Nigeria.org.

Topics.value: Indigenous Technology and Inter group relation in Pre colonial Nigeria

Learning Objects.value: By the end of the lesson, students should be able to: Explain Indigenous technology and inter group relation.Examaine the processes, structure and features of indigenous technology and inter group relation in pre-colonial Nigeria i.e. salt making, wood carving.Mention the Various indigenous technology and inter group relations and the importance of Nigeria society today.Relate the advantages and disadvantages of the indigenous technology and inter group relation in Nigeria today.

Learning Activities.value: Students in a whole class discussion explain the concept “indigenous technology and inter group relation”Students in small groups relate the origin, features, processes of indigenous technology and the impact on inter group relation etc. In pre-colonial Nigeria.Students in small groups discuss the achievements of the various indigenous technology on Nigeria today.Student in a whole class discussion examine the advantages and disadvantages of indigenous industries on inter group relation in Nigeria society

Embedded Core Skills.value: Creativity and Innovation.Critical thinking and problem solving.Collaboration and Communication.Digital Literacy.

Learning Resources.value: Project work of specific indigenous industries in your school location i.e. moulding, bronze casting, mat weaving etc. Pictures of indigenous industries and technologists at work i.e. weavers on a loom Journal, Magazine etc.Internet resources www.indigenous-industries.org.

Embedded Core Skills.value: Revision of all embedded core skills
